channel.title: Selected Projects on Wenyao Liu
channel.description: Recent content in Selected Projects on Wenyao Liu

item.title: 1. Spatial-temporal Analysis on Connected Vehicle Data for Improving Transportation Safety
item.description: **Note: The project is undergoing and some details cannot be provided.** Introduction This undergoing project aims to reveal traffic patterns in sensor data from thousands of connected vehicles in Oklahoma and investigate their correlation with roadway crashes. Methods Using Apache Spark for processing and filtering the big data sets (489 GB in total). Visualized vehicle data with ArcGIS and identified traffic and crash data hot spots. Building CNN-based deep learning models and Bayesian hierarchy models (BHM) for predicting roadway crashes based on corresponding vehicular data.

item.title: 2. Similarity Checking on Four Speed Measurment Systems in Oklahoma
item.description: **Note: The project is undergoing and some details cannot be provided.** Introduction Accurately measure the traffic speed on pavement network it is vital to decision making in transportation system. Four speed measurment systems are available in Oklahoma and their compabilty is unknown. Featured results 1. Viualize the site/segment in different systems Fig. 1 Speed measurement location comparisons 2. Compare the similarity between 4 systems site by site Fig. 2 Similarity factors between 4 systems site by site (-1 to 1, with 1 as the best)

item.title: 3. Utilizing Pavement Friction Data for the Reduction of Traffic Crashes
item.description: Sponsored by the Oklahoma Department of Transportation (ODOT), this study identifies the contributing factors to traffic crashes and provides decision-making models.

item.title: 4. Peridynamics-based Simulation of Asphalt Mixture Cracking in Semi-circular Bending (SCB) Test
item.description:
Highlights

  1. Peridynamics model was applied to simulate SCB testing for asphalt mixtures.
  2. Cracking patterns in simulation match lab observations well.
  3. Fracture energy and P-u curve from simulation agrees with experimental results.
  4. Arch effect and energy transformation during SCB testing were investigated.
